Notes:
(Updated: Apr 17) **Eligibility**: Age 18+ at county clinics. 

**County restrictions**: Must be residents of, or work in Yuba-Sutter counties. 

**Appointment Information**: To make an appointment for the FIRST or SECOND VACCINE, click on this link:  <https://tinyurl.com/5ban9u3s> New Clinic information is released on Wednesdays at 9am.

**Phone numbers**: To make appointments by phone calls can only be made to (530) 822-5985 between the hours of 9 am-4 pm M-F

**Additional Info**: Yuba-Sutter transit is offering free rides for Covid-19 vaccination appointments,
For Yuba-Sutter Transit service, route, and schedule information, visit http://www.yubasuttertransit.com or call (530) 742-2877.

If there are no more appointments available, consider signing up to be wait-listed in the event the clinic has "no shows" or cancellations. The waitlist DOES NOT GUARANTEE you a spot for an appointment for the clinic. In the event you do not get called, please register for our next county clinic.

Información en español: <https://tinyurl.com/ysyss4mw>

(Updated: Apr 20) **Eligibility**: Age 16+   Mariposa County has the Pfizer vaccine available at a few clinics. Pfizer which is the only vaccine with an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for 16 years and older. 

**Mariposa County Public Health **will be pulling names from their COVID-19 Vaccine Contact List and have enough doses to reach more people than they currently have on the list. If you or people you know are eligible, please visit [www.mariposacounty.org/vaccine](http://www.mariposacounty.org/vaccine).

**County restrictions**: Must be a resident of Mariposa county

**Appointment Information**: Fill out a form to be placed on the contact list, by clicking on this link: <https://tinyurl.com/33t58bv7> If you have already submitted your contact information and have not been called yet, please dial (209) 966-1133 for a recorded update on where our County currently is in the vaccine administering schedule.

**Phone numbers**: If you do not have access to the internet, please call (209) 259-1332 for assistance

(Updated: April 12)**Eligibility**: 16+

**County restrictions**:County Residents and eligible sector residents employed in SBC.

**Appointment Information**:Minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. <https://publichealthsbc.org/covid-19-vaccine-appointment-registration/>. 

**Phone numbers**:The county suggests calling 2-1-1 and select option 4, Child care workers information 805-925-7071. 
[#COVID19](https://twitter.com/hashtag/COVID19?src=hashtag_click) vaccine clinics increasing to 7 days per week beginning Sunday, 3/28/21, in [#Lompoc](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Lompoc?src=hashtag_click). Appointment registration is now open for all [#SantaBarbaraCounty](https://twitter.com/hashtag/SantaBarbaraCounty?src=hashtag_click) residents in eligible groups. Make an appointment now at: <https://publichealthsbc.org/community-vaccination-clinics/> or call 2-1-1 and select 4 
**Additional Info**: Appointments offered by the Santa Barbara County Public Health Department sites for this sector will be posted on Mondays at 9:00 am.

Santa Barbara Public Health is starting a phased rollout of "My Turn" scheduling system for Vaccination Appointments, starting Monday, April 12

April 9Santa Barbara County opening up appointments for a new mobile clinic next week -> <https://twitter.com/SBCPublicHealth/status/1380203238704701441?s=20>

(Updated: Apr 13)  **Eligibility:** 16+
Note:  A parent or Legal Guardian will need to be present at the vaccine clinic for anyone under the age of 18.

**County restrictions:** Must be a Stanislaus county resident or work in Stanislaus county

**Appointment Information:**
The county has details on clinics (mostly first-come, first-served, ie no appointments needed) on their website at <http://schsa.org/coronavirus/vaccine/>

**Phone numbers:** Public Information line at (209) 558-7535

**Additional Info:** County site updated every Friday or as vaccine availability changes.

According to the county, vaccination screening forms will be provided at the clinics. If you wish to fill out your screening prior to arriving at the clinic, the form is available for you to print at <http://schsa.org/coronavirus/vaccine/pdf/covid-vaccine-screening.pdf>

(Updated: Apr 15) **Eligibility**: Age 16+

**County restrictions**: Must be a resident of Santa Cruz. 

**Appointment Information**: If you wish to sign up  for vaccines, please click this link:  **[http://MyTurn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov/)**.

**Phone numbers**: If you are over 65, call the Bridges to Access Vaccination Helpline to get assistance in obtaining the COVID-19
vaccine at (831) 219-8607. Leave a message with your name, phone number, age and zip code and you will  get a call back within 48 hours.

**Additional Info**: Residents interested in vaccines should first contact their medical provider. Vaccines are also available through sites listed on the chart below. Residents should also sign up for MyTurn to be notified once they are eligible, by visiting **[MyTurn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/)**. The Public Health Division will distribute vaccine through the counties
**[local vaccine plan](https://www.santacruzhealth.org/Portals/7/pdfs/coronavirus/2020.12.7_FINAL%20C19%20Vax%20Template%20for%20Santa%20Cruz%20County.pdf)**.

For information about registering for an appointment with various health care providers, click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/ync6h3r7>

(Updated: Apr 15) **Eligibility**: 16+

(Updated: Apr 15) **Eligibility**: 16+

**Appointment Information**: Those 16 or 17 are approved for the Pfizer vaccine at this time. A parent or legal guardian must be present at the time of the appointment to provide consent. More information on appointments can be found here: [sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html](https://sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html). 

**Phone Numbers**: Contact 211 with any questions.

**Additional Info:** San Joaquin RTD is now providing free rides on all fixed-route buses traveling to county SJReady vaccination sites. To ride free, check your eligibility and book your appointment on MyTurn ([myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov)) or on SJReady ([sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html](https://sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html)), then show your appointment confirmation via a print-out or on your phone to the operator when boarding. More information can be found here: <https://sanjoaquinrtd.com/covid-19/#freerides>

(Updated: Apr 12) **Eligibility:** 16+

**County Restrictions:** Must be a resident of Humboldt County.

**Appointment Information:** Visit MyTurn ([myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/)) to be notified of eligibility and sign up for an appointment. If you have received the first dose of a two-dose vaccine from public health and need a second dose, you will be contacted by Public Health or the provider whom you received your first dose from. For more information about eligibility and appointment scheduling on MyTurn, please click here: <https://humboldtgov.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3853>. 16 and 17-year old residents must select a Pfizer clinic when registering and follow the guidelines outlined here: <https://humboldtgov.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3866> 

**Phone Numbers:** Those without access to email or a mobile phone or who have questions about My Turn can call the California COVID-19 Hotline at 1-833-422-4255. For general information, questions about second-dose appointments or assistance navigating this new process, call the Humboldt County Joint Information Center at 707-441-5000, Monday through Friday, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

**Additional Info:** Contact the COVID Community Information Line at 707-441-5000 or covidinfo@co.humboldt.ca.us. Para información en español: [Información sobre la Vacuna de COVID-19](https://humboldtgov.org/2887/La-Vacuna).

(Updated: Apr 13) **Eligibility**: 16+
Also: Effective immediately, those who accompany an eligible family member to an appointment are eligible, too, even if they don’t fall into an eligible category – but they must have an appointment at the same location and at approximately the same time as their eligible family member. Those accompanying someone 65 or over, a person with a serious underlying health condition or disability, a food worker, or anyone else who is eligible should sign up for an appointment as a member of that eligible cohort, and accompany that eligible person to the appointment.

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in San Bernardino County

**Appointment Information**: <https://sbcovid19.com/vaccine/locations/>

**Phone number**: For vaccine questions and help, call the county's COVID-19 hotline at (909) 387-3911 from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. Monday through Friday.

Omnitrans offers [free vaccination shuttles](https://omnitrans.org/blog/omnitrans-offers-free-vaccination-shuttle-in-ontario-and-san-bernardino/) in Ontario and San Bernardino.

(Updated: Apr 13) **Eligibility**: Ages 16+

**County restrictions**:As healthcare providers are providing vaccine in Santa Clara County, some providers have restrictions.

**Appointment Information**:Go to <https://www.sccgov.org/sites/covid19/Pages/COVID19-vaccine-information-for-public.aspx> to see sites where healthcare providers offering vaccine and to make appointments.

**Phone numbers**:(408) 792-5050 Santa Clara Dept of Public Health 

**Additional Info**:Santa Clara County, VTA has created an [interactive map](https://www.vta.org/sites/default/files/2021-02/FINAL%20VaccinationMap-02-23-21b_SHR.pdf) for the public to find a list of the current vaccination locations, along with the bus or light rail routes to take to each site. Transit trips are free as VTA is [currently not collecting fares](https://www.vta.org/blog/service-frequency-improvements-no-fare-collection-effect-feb-8). Website has information in Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese, Tagalong

(Updated: Apr 15) **Eligibility**: Nevada County Public Health has opened up vaccine eligibility to everyone 16 and older.

**Appointment Information**: Public Health is releasing appointments every Friday at noon on [MyTurn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov/) for appointments at the Whispering Pines Grass Valley vaccine clinic. 

**Additional Info**: A standby list is available for those working in Education and childcare, Emergency services. and Food and Agriculture. This list is for same-day appointments at our Grass Valley clinic to ensure that no dose is wasted. Information about the standby list is available here: <https://www.mynevadacounty.com/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3632>
 
To protect confidentiality, verification documentation of the diagnosis or type of disability is not required but instead anyone meeting the eligibility requirements will be asked to sign a self-attestation that they meet the criteria for high-risk medical conditions or disabilities.

(Updated: Apr 12) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating people 16+ who live or work in Butte County. 

Please note: residents who book a vaccination appointment through a community or hospital vaccination clinic that utilizes the MyTurn, the State’s scheduling system, will need to check the ’65-74’ age range option to get the scheduling process started. This is due to a current limitation within the State’s online scheduling system. You will then be prompted to enter your date of birth at which time you will enter your actual date of birth.

**Appointment Information**: Appointment information can be found here: https://www.buttecounty.net/ph/COVID19/vaccine

**Phone numbers**: For residents without internet, you may call the Vaccine Scheduling Hotline at 530-552-3020 for assistance – please reserve this line for those without internet. Calling the hotline will not book your appointment faster.

**Additional Info:** Transportation is available to vaccination sites through the B-Line’s Paratransit service for persons 70 and older. An application must be completed in advance of the first ride. Applications can be requested over the phone at 530-809-4614, or downloaded at [tinyurl.com/ButteParatransit](http://tinyurl.com/ButteParatransit). A one-way ride on the Paratransit is $3.50.

(Updated: Apr 13) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating residents 18+ for clinics run by the County. DHHS (Department of Health and Human Services) does not currently have any allocated vaccine for those 16-17 years old. Those whishing the vaccine in this age group please follow up directly with your primary care physician.

**Appointment Information**: Information about how and where to schedule a vaccine appointment can be found here: https://www.countyofcolusa.org/771/COVID19

(Updated: Apr 13) **Eligibility**: Ages 16+

**County restrictions**: Vaccinations are free for people who live or work in San Francisco

**Appointment Information**: The page includes appointments for county and private-provider sites: https://sf.gov/get-vaccinated-against-covid-19

**Phone number**: For those who don't have internet access or have difficulty using websites, San Francisco recommends calling the state's MyTurn appointment system: (833) 422-4255.

**Additional information**: [Sign up to get notified](https://sf.gov/get-notified-when-its-your-turn-vaccine/form) when it's your turn for the vaccine.
You can ride [Muni or Paratransit for free](https://www.sfmta.com/blog/free-muni-and-paratransit-covid-19-vaccine-appointments), to and from your appointment.

(Updated Apr 15) **Eligibility**: 16+

**Appointment Information**: For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://www.co.siskiyou.ca.us/publichealth/page/covid-19-vaccine-information>. 

**Phone numbers**: For questions or concerns please call (530) 841-2134 or email [phinfo@co.siskiyou.ca.us](mailto:phinfo@co.siskiyou.ca.us)

**Additional Information**: For information about underlying health conditions that make you eligible to receive the vaccine please click here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx> 

Eligibility is expanding soon to cover:
- Individuals 50 or older - **effective April 1, 2021** 
- Every Californian 16 or older - **effective April 15, 2021**

(Updated: Apr 13) **Eligibility**: 16+ (For Pfizer vaccine. 18+ for Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccines)

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Tehama County. Proof of residence or employment will be required at the time of vaccination. Acceptable forms are a photo ID, employer ID badge, employer payment stub or official letter from the employer.

**Appointment Information**: Tehama County uses My Turn, the California Department of Public Health COVID-19 Vaccine scheduling system: <https://myturn.ca.gov>

**Phone numbers**: For assistance in registering with My Turn, dial: (833) 422-4255. To talk to the Tehama County Health Services Agency about topics other than vaccine appointment scheduling, dial: (530) 527-6824.

**Additional information**: You can contact the Tehama County Health Services Agency at: [publichealth@tchsa.net](mailto:publichealth@tchsa.net)

(Updated: Apr 14) **Eligibility**:16+

**County restrictions**: County Residents and eligible sector residents employed in county.

**Appointment Information**: ** schedule through the [California MyTurn](https://myturn.ca.gov/)system online at: <https://myturn.ca.gov/>**

**Phone numbers:** (833) 422-4255.(For those without internet access)

**Additional Info**: .
Información Sobre La Vacuna COVID 19: [Información Sobre La Vacuna COVID 19 | County of Glenn](https://www.countyofglenn.net/dept/health-human-services/public-health/covid-19/informaci%C3%B3n-sobre-la-vacuna-covid-19)

Appointments are opened up to the public weekly, typically on Sunday night, for this Site through [#MyTurn](https://twitter.com/hashtag/MyTurn?src=hashtag_click)

(Updated: Apr 16) **Eligibility:** 16+ 

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in El Dorado County.

**Appointment Information:** Minors ages 16-17 require a parent/guardian to be present at time of vaccination. The county directs all residents to contact their primary care provider as their first and best option to receive a vaccine. You may need to provide proof of age, residency, and/or employment status in the county at the time of your appointment. For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://www.edcgov.us/Government/hhsa/Pages/EDCCOVID-19-clinics.aspx> 

**Phone Numbers:** Seniors 75+ who need extra help scheduling an appointment for the vaccine can call 530-295-4101. Call the county's COVID phone line at 211 or 833-223-9797, or email [EDCCOVID-19@edcgov.us](http://EDCCOVID-19@edcgov.us) 

**Additional Info:** Seniors 75+ can also receive assistance at each of its county libraries, with more information here: <https://www.edcgov.us/Government/hhsa/PublishingImages/pages/EDCCOVID-19-vaccine/COVID19%20Senior%20Services%20VC%20Flyer%202.2.21.pdf>. For those who are not currently eligible to receive a vaccine, you can sign up for notifications about phases/tier changes using this form: <https://forms.gle/J152S7TYTv3pmDu97>. Contact EDCCOVID-19@edcgov.us with any questions.

(Updated: Apr 14) **Eligibility**: 16+ People age 16 or 17 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. 

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Marin County. 

**Appointment Information**: Complete the vaccination interest form: <https://marincountyhc.jotform.com/210187732830049>
 
**Phone number**: County residents who have limited or no internet can call (833) 641-1988 to get live help, Mon-Fri, 8 am to 5 pm. This number  also is available to county residents age 65 or older; those living with disabilities and age 18 or older; those in need of home care or personal assistance; those who need language interpretation (including ASL); or those who need help arranging transportation to a vaccination appointment. 

**Additional information:** New appointments are opened on Friday afternoons.  The county asks that you not call or email Marin Public Health to make an appointment. 

Free public transit is offered by Sonoma-Marin Area Rail Transit for vaccine appointment holders to either the Civic Center or Larkspur train stations. Marin Transit will offer a free shuttle to/from the train station to the nearby vaccine sites.

(Updated: Apr 15) **Eligibility**:16+

**County restrictions**:Live or work in Ventura County

**Appointment Information**:Please note, only Pfizer is approved for use for those age 16-17. As of March 27th Ventura County is having registration for the COVID vaccine through the state My Turn system. 
<https://myturn.ca.gov>

**Phone numbers**:805-477-7161(for those with limited internet access) 

**Additional Info**:Appointments open on Monday mornings at 7 am online and at 8 am on the phoneline . Appointments also open throughout the week from cancellations and/or additional allocations from the state.
The Area Agency on Aging provides transportation services for older adults that are in need of transportation to a vaccine appointment or for COVID-19 testing. This includes people that need lift assist as well as gurney transportation. The driver will take the individual, wait for them, help them at the site and take them home. To schedule a ride call 805-477-7300
Need a first dose? Vaccine appointments are currently available for April 12 at the vaccine site in Santa Paula, located at the former K-Mart building at 895 Faulkner Rd. Register at [https://myturn.ca.gov.](https://myturn.ca.gov/) The type of vaccine being provided is Pfizer.

(Updated: Apr 11) **Eligibility**: Residents 16 and older

**Appointment Information**: Information about vaccine appointments can be found here: https://www.smchealth.org/covid-19-vaccination and https://www.smchealth.org/post/covid-19-vaccine

**Additional Info: **SamTrans will provide free bus rides on existing service to COVID-19 vaccination sites for people living or working within San Mateo County. [Read more here](https://www.samtrans.com/about/MediaRelations/news/SamTrans_to_Provide_Free_Rides_to_Vaccination_Sites_in_San_Mateo_County.html).

(Updated Apr 17) **Eligibility**: All Sierra County Residents 18 years or older regardless of medical conditions, as well as previous tiers of 65+, or in Education, Emergency services, Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers. 

**County restrictions**: Must be a Sierra county resident

**Additional Information**: Due to the high number of Sierra County residents already vaccinated, and expanded availability of vaccine throughout California, Sierra County Public Health is no longer maintaining an interest/wait list. See options for scheduling vaccinations here: <https://sierracounty.ca.gov/616/About-Vaccine-for-COVID-19>

(Updated: Apr 17)**Eligibility**: 18+

**County restrictions**:Eligible residents of Trinity County, or neighboring counties if employed in Trinity County 

**Appointment Information**:https://www.trinitycounty.org/COVID19-Vaccine

**Phone numbers**: 530-623-8235

**Additional Info**: Based on Website information from press releases in February. For latest press releases visit: <https://www.trinitycounty.org/COVID-19/Press-Releases>

(Updated: Apr 15)  **Eligibility**: 16+

**County restrictions**: Must be a Plumas county resident or work in Plumas county

**Appointment Information**: 
Appointments for vaccination clinics must be made through MyTurn; however, walk-ins are welcomed but there is no guarantee of extra doses. 

**Phone numbers**: Individuals without access to the internet can call the Public Health Services Department at 530-283-6188.
Call the CA COVID-19 Hotline at 1-833-422-4255 
(M-F 8AM-8PM, Sa-Su 8AM-5PM) for assistance with MyTurn.

**Additional Info**: County site updated weekly by Friday at 5pm.

(Updated Apr 26) **Walk-ins** All locations hosted by Riverside County Public Health (both clinics and mobile sites) are eligible for walk-ins as well as appointments. Appointments are required at other locations unless otherwise stated. 

(Updated: Apr 12) **Eligibility**: Age 16+
Teenagers 16 and 17 years old must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian and register for a vaccination clinic that offers the Pfizer vaccine.

**Appointment Information**: For FIRST DOSE Vaccine please click on this link:  [COVID-19 Vaccine (rivcoph.org)](https://www.rivcoph.org/COVID-19-Vaccine-with-Registration) or                                                
for a SECOND DOSE appointment, Riverside County health officials will reach out to residents through the contact method provided at the first appointment.

**Phone numbers**: For seniors 65 and older who need assistance, please dial 2-1-1 or (951) 329-4703

**Additional Info**: Residents who received their first dose at a private provider, should contact that same provider to schedule their second dose. 

NOTICE: Residents may now schedule their 2nd dose appointment at any of the RUHS-Public Health Clinics or Curative Clinics.

(Updated Apr 15) **Eligibility**: 16+

**County restrictions**: Must be a Mendocino county resident or work in Mendocino county

**Appointment Information**: For information about county clinics and booking appointments please click this link: <https://www.mendocinocounty.org/community/novel-coronavirus/covid-19-vaccinations/vaccination-clinics> 

**Phone numbers**: Contact the call center (hablamos español) for more information at 707-472-2759, Monday to Friday 8:30am - 5:00pm.

**Additional Info**: The county is scheduling vaccination events for first doses, to learn more call (707) 472-2663 or email DOC-vaccine@mendocinocounty.org with the subject line, “1st dose of Pfizer.”

(Updated Apr 15) **Eligibility**: 16+

**County restrictions**: Must be an Inyo county resident

**Additional Information: **Please sign up for **[the Inyo County Registration list](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfxml4iOjuCy2dwsppYDHK-bpCbZA2uU0lM699zlVtllE7o5Q/viewform)** to receive email updates to find out when vaccine will be available to you. Updates are sent weekly to everyone on the Inyo County Registration list. You can also see details about vaccine clinics opening up in the county and their eligibility criteria here: https://www.inyocounty.us/covid-19/local-updates

(Updated: Apr 12) **Eligibility**: Age 16+

(Updated: Apr 12) **Eligibility**: 16+

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Alameda County.

**Appointment Information:** For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://covid-19.acgov.org/vaccines.page?#eligibility-hcp>. 

**Phone Numbers:** Contact the county public health department at 510-268-2101.

**Additional Info:** Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccines are only approved for individuals 18+. (Updated: Apr 16) **Eligibility:** 16+

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Lake County.

**Appointment Information:** All appointments are now being scheduled on MyTurn ([myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/)), where appointments will be released 48 hours in advance. For more information please click this link: <http://health.co.lake.ca.us/Coronavirus/Vaccines.htm>. Individuals will need to show ID and proof of residence at the time of the appointment, as well as proof of eligibility if applicable (or fill out the self-attestation form found here: <http://health.co.lake.ca.us/Assets/Departments/Health/Public+Health+Division/COVID-19/Vaccines/3.15.21+COVID+Vaccine+Self-Attestation+form.pdf>). People age 16-17 (with parental consent) can sign up here to be notified when Pfizer appointments are available in Lake County <http://health.co.lake.ca.us/Coronavirus/Vaccines/Vaccination_Request_Form.htm>. 

**Phone Numbers:** County farmworkers can call 707-262-4162, 707-262-4153, or 707-262-4159, Monday - Friday, 9-5 for assistance. Please do not call these numbers if appointments are filled. If you have questions about the vaccine, call 211 or 707-263-8174, or text "covid19" to 211-211.

**Additional Info:** Appointments will be scheduled for individuals 16+ depending on state allocation.

(Updated: Apr 15) **Eligibility**: 16+

**County restrictions**:Napa County's vaccination efforts are available for those who either live or work in Napa County 

**Appointment Information**:**Schedule through the California MyTurn system online at: <https://myturn.ca.gov/>**

**Phone numbers:**(833) 422-4255. or [(707) 253-4270](https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=Napa+County+department+of+public+health&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8#) Napa County Public Health

**Additional Info**:Website also in Spanish
[Kaiser Permanente](https://mydoctor.kaiserpermanente.org/covid-19/covid-19-vaccine) has a COVID-19 vaccine webpage for members to check their vaccine status online.

[St. Joseph Health](https://coronavirus.providence.org/blog/uf/646123480) outlines how they're reaching out to eligible patients.
[Sutter Health's vaccine resource page](https://www.sutterhealth.org/for-patients/health-alerts/covid-19-vaccine) has ways to check eligibility and schedule appointments.

(Updated: Apr 13) **Eligibility**: 16+ (16 or 17 years old can receive the Pfizer vaccine; 18+ can receive the Pfizer, Moderna or Johnson & Johnson vaccine.) 

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Kings County. Proof of address and/or employment status in Kings County will be required at the time of your appointment.

**Appointment Information**: To check eligibility and book an appointment at Kings County Public Health use: <https://myturn.ca.gov> . If you need assistance in making an appointment, Call the California COVID-19 Hotline: (833) 422-4255 (M-F 8AM-8PM, Sa-Su 8AM-5PM)
Transportation is available by KART: Please call (559)852-2776 to request transportation to your vaccine appointment. Please provide a 24 hour notice prior to your appointment time.

(Updated: Apr 17) **Eligibility**: 18+. 16 and 17 years old interested in receiving the COVID vaccine are encouraged to call the COVID WarmLine to get on the vaccine waitlist: 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171.

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Modoc County.

**Appointment Information**: Call the county's COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 to schedule an appointment. Individuals ages 16-17 are encouraged to join the waitlist by calling 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday. For more information, please click this link: <https://publichealth.co.modoc.ca.us/covid-19_information/covid-19_vaccine/index.php> 

**Phone Numbers**: Call the county's COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday with any questions.

**Additional Info**: The county anticipates providing 200 doses during the week of Apr 5-9.

(Updated: Apr 11) **Eligibility**: We are now vaccinating anyone age 16 and older.

**County restrictions**: Proof of Tuolumne County residence or employment is required.

**Appointment Information**: Vaccine clinic information and a vaccine interest form for eligible residents can be found here: https://www.tuolumnecounty.ca.gov/1317/COVID-Vaccine
